p: The literature describes contextual factors such as climate, seasonality and socioeconomic conditions for disease vector control. A survey conducted in Taiwan, for example, observed whether low temperatures can influence the distribution of the mosquito and identified that a temperature of 13.8 °C is a critical temperature to limit the occurrence of Ae. aegypti [ 26]. A study into the occurrence of dengue fever was conducted in seven municipalities of Greater São Paulo in 2010–2013, showing that the months of January to May were those with the highest number of reported cases in the south-east of Brazil [ 32], explained by the authors as being a product of the higher rainfall in this area during those months. Our study in Campina Grande indicates that the infestation levels were higher during the months of May to September, which correlates with the higher levels of rainfall.
